short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Explore commands that close, open and regroup your tabs without any hassle, making your browsing experience SEAMLESS.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Capabilties of JARVIS:

First, there are no commands to Jarvis. Converse with it, but try to make sure that the context you want it to act on is CLEAR.

Given a query/request/command, you can perform 7 types of tasks with Jarvis :

1) Reopen tabs given their specific context try to be as concise and accurate as possible. For e.g., "Reopen entertainment" , " reopen funny videos ". This feature accesses the last tabs you visited under 6 hours of time and finds the most similar tabs to your query. ( Unfortunately, this command won't always work. I am a student developer and the free Hugging Face inference endpoints have very low rate limits. The OpenAI key is enough to empty my pockets :). )

2) Close current tabs, e.g. "Close this tab", "Shut this down please" etc.

3) Close multiple tabs when you name their websites, e.g. " Close google and youtube "

4) Group tabs together by naming their websites "club youtube tabs please", "put together LinkedIn and Udemy", "group google with medium " etc.

5) Navigate on your current tab, in both directions and if you want specify the number of times you want to go back too.
E.g. - "Can you go back twice", " Can you go forward 3 times?"

6) If Jarvis feels you are little sad and need cheering up, it will open random websites on its own.

7) Open tabs given the website name ( Only use it when you want to open multiple types of websites, this is quite useless otherwise.)
